A Hybrid Approach to University Timetabling Using Monte Carlo Tree Search, Hill Climbing and Diving

  • mcts module
  • View page source

mcts module

This module implements the Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) algorithm for solving the CB-CTT problem. It uses the standard MCTS steps: selection, expansion, simulation, and backpropagation, combined with hill climbing and a diving approach.

class mcts.MCTS(current_timetable, config)[source]

Bases: object

Main class implementing the MCTS algorithm.

Configuration object for MCTS.

Type:

MCTSConfig

rooms

Available rooms in the schedule.

Type:

dict

events

Events to be scheduled.

Type:

list

root

Root of the MCTS tree.

Type:

MCTSNode

current_node

Node currently being expanded or simulated.

Type:

MCTSNode

backpropagation(simulation_result_hard, simulation_result_soft)[source]

Backpropagate simulation results up the tree.

Parameters:

  • simulation_result_hard (float) – Normalized hard score.

  • simulation_result_soft (float) – Normalized soft score.

expansion()[source]

Perform the expansion phase of MCTS by adding a new child to the current node.

Returns:

True if a new node was successfully added, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

normalize(result, best, worst)[source]

Normalize a hard or soft score between 0 and 1 using an exponential scale.

Parameters:

  • result (float) – The result value to normalize.

  • best (float) – Best (highest) known value.

  • worst (float) – Worst (lowest) known value.

Returns:

Normalized score.

Return type:

float

run_mcts()[source]

Run the full MCTS loop: selection, expansion, simulation, backpropagation.

Handles early stopping based on time or optimality conditions. Outputs profiling, debug trees, or metric plots if enabled.

selection()[source]

Perform the selection phase of MCTS.

Returns:

True if selection was successful, False if the tree is fully expanded.

Return type:

bool

simulation(start_time, time_limit)[source]

Perform the simulation phase by assigning events using heuristics or randomness.

Parameters:

  • start_time (float) – Timestamp when MCTS started.

  • time_limit (int) – Maximum allowed runtime.

Returns:

Normalized hard and soft penalty scores (float, float).

Return type:

tuple

update_progress_metrics(iteration)[source]

Update metrics for tracking progress over iterations.

Parameters:

iteration (int) – The current iteration number.

class mcts.Params(c_param=1.4, iterations=None, time_limit=300)[source]

Bases: object

MCTS parameters.

c_param: float = 1.4

Exploration-exploitation constant for UCT.

iterations: int = None

Number of MCTS iterations to perform.

time_limit: int = 300

Maximum runtime in seconds.
